title: Qasas ul Anbiya (Stories of the Prophets)
description:
Qasas ul Anbiya (Stories of the Prophets) 
The "Qisas Al-Anbiya" (Ã™â€šÃ˜ÂµÃ˜Âµ Ã˜Â§Ã™â€žÃ˜Â£Ã™â€ Ã˜Â¨Ã™Å Ã˜Â§Ã˜Â¡) or Stories of the Prophets is any of various collections of tales adapted from the Quran and other Islamic literature, closely related to exegesis of the Qur'an. One of the best-known is that composed by Kisa'i in either the 6th or the 13th century; others include the Ara'is al-majalis by al-Tha'alabi (d. 427 AH, 1035 CE) and the Qasas al-anbiya by Ibn Kathir (d. 774 AH, 1372 CE).
